Package managers

Class PageObjectManager

java.lang.Object
managers.PageObjectManager
public class PageObjectManager extends Object
Makes new page instance or returns the one already made. In the case of multiple-step definition files, we will be creating an object of Pages again and again. Which is against the coding principle.

To avoid this situation, we can create a Page Object Manager. The duty of the Page Object Manager is to create the page's object and also to make sure that the same object should not be created again and again. But to use a single object for all the step definition files.

  • Method Details

    • getHomePage

      public HomePage getHomePage()
      Get the homepage instance If there is not a Homepage created yet, make a new one. Otherwise, use the one we have.
      Returns:
      HomePage The one instance of this class that is used in the scenario.

    • getCoursesPage

      public CoursesPage getCoursesPage()
      Get the CoursesPage instance If there is not a CoursesPage created yet, make a new one. Otherwise, use the one we have.

    • getNewCourseDetailsPage

      public CourseDetailsPage getNewCourseDetailsPage()
      Create a new instance of a CourseDetailsPage Here, we do not follow the method of the other pages because we need a new page for each course.
      Returns:
      CourseDetailsPage new instance of the CourseDetailsPage the driver is currently on.
